page.title: 02TOURISM GILWERN CANAL
page.content: The canal is 33 miles in length and passes through Gilwern.It was initially used to transport materials from local mines and quarries to the sea at Newport,on the estuary of the River Usk.These days,the canal is very popular with local people and tourists alike.Many people cruise along the canal in boats and modern cruisers.The canal itself being well served with amenities such as general stores,pubs,fishing facilities etc.The canal is to be found in a lovely setting,and it has numerous attractions to those people who wish to go for canalside walks.There is plenty of wildlife, both aquatic and land based,which is of immense interest to conservationists and laymen alike. All in all, the canal is an extremely popular attraction,with always plenty to both see and do.
